result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany Marie Konieczka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 5, 2015.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF312

miscConds.notes: $243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM602.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Submit to random and regular testing as required by Agent.
-Participate in Restorative Justice Program.
-Maintain employment/education.
-Participate in all programs required by Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Court finds there is no restitution due for either case.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan.  ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Brittany Marie Konieczka appeared. Includes 15CF312, 15CM113, 14CF365, and Intake for 15CM602. Case called at 9:39 am. ADA Correll recites agreement. Atty. Chapman confirms. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DF pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CF312 and DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM602. DF sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DF of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DF Guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF312 and finds DF Guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM602. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Cts 2-14 in 15CF312, dismisses 15CM113 and 14CF365. Court waives PSI and reserves right to Order PSI in future. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

15CF312 - S/W, 4 years probation, with conditions
-5 mos jail STAYED
- Court costs $268
-DNA surcharge $250
-Eligible for expungement upon application and successful completion
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Submit to random/regular testing as required by probation agent
-Participate in restorative justice 
-Maintain employment/education
-Pay all supervision fees
-Participate in all programs required by probation agent

15CM602 - S/W, 1 year probation concurrent - without prejudice to consecutive upon revocation, with conditions
-AODA assessment
-Court costs $243
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Submit to random/regular testing as required by probation agent
-Participate in restorative justice 
-Maintain employment/education
-Pay all supervision fees
-Participate in all programs required by probation agent

-Court finds there is no restitution due for either case.

DF to report to probation today
